"Reddish glow" on an ingenious contrivance


Ingenious �Saucer� Just Misses Woman

  • Boston Herald
    July 13, 1947
(Boston Herald � N.Y. Times Dispatch)

LINDEN, N.J., July 12 � A �flying saucer� which frightened and narrowly missed striking Mrs. William H. Scott as she entered her home here late last night, today was termed by Army officials from Port Newark who examined it at police headquarters as an �ingenious contrivance� consisting of two tin pie plates soldered together with a bulb, similar to a radio tube, attached to the inside, and an airplane tail.

Mrs. Scott said the �saucer� landed in a patch of grass in the rear of her home, imbedding itself in the turf. She said she saw the bulb light with a reddish glow as she ran, frightened, into the house.
 

End of article
